text:
News Police make 10 arrests during dawn raids across north Manchester Officers stormed 15 addresses in Ancoats, Miles Platting, New Islington and Harpurhey on Thursday morning as part of an operation to tackle dealing on the streets Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ten men have been arrested in early morning drugs raids across north Manchester . 
Specially trained officers stormed 15 addresses on Thursday morning as part of an operation to tackle dealing on the streets. 
Detective Inspector Paul Walker confirmed 10 men had been detained after warrants in Ancoats , Miles Platting , New Islington and Harpurhey , with more arrests expected throughout the day. 
Two properties on Old Mill Street were raided, with officers from the tactical aid team smashing their way in through windows at the rear of the house. Police then searched the properties before two men were brought out in handcuffs and put into the back of a police van. Police made 10 arrests after warrants in Ancoats, Miles Platting, New Islington and Harpurhey (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Read More Large amount of 'potentially dangerous' prescription drugs stolen from pharmacy in Oldham 
GMP said the raids were organised by officers from Operation Rudow, which is part of the larger Operation Challenger – a long running multi-agency initiative targeting organised crime around the supply of drugs across Greater Manchester. 
DI Walker said: “This morning we executed warrants at 15 addresses across north Manchester which resulted in the arrests of 10 people on suspicion of supplying Class A drugs. (Photo: GMP) 
“Enquiries are ongoing to trace several other people, with more warrants and arrests going on throughout the day.” 
He explained the raids were carried out as a result of community-based intelligence. 
Chief Superintendent Wasim Chaudry described Operation Rudow as ‘bringing an end to drug fuelled misery and taking action against those that dare to try and ruin our communities. Tactical aid officers smashed their way in through doors and windows (Photo: GMP) Read More More than 200 anti-Semitic incidents reported in Greater Manchester last year 
He said in a leaflet to residents: “We raided a number of addresses and those suspected of being involved in drug dealing have been arrested. 
"The latest crackdown comes following complaints about drug dealing from the community. Residents have told us about their concerns and we have taken action today to resolve them. 
“Drugs have a devastating affect on communities and attract unwelcome antisocial behaviour such as loitering on the streets, drug dealing and discarded syringes. Officers are briefed before the raids (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Read More Dangerous armed robber who escaped prison by climbing over a wall is back behind bars 
“Drugs also fuel other types of crime including burglary, vehicle crime and robbery. 
“I hope that today’s activity reassures you that tackling drug related criminality is one of our top priorities.” Like us on Facebook
